attr.q: Let \tau be the finite-closed topology on a set X. If \tau is also the discrete topology, prove that the set X is finite.
attr.a: Let's say that X is infinite. Since \tau is finite-closed, every open sets must be infinite. It can't be a discrete topology. Contradiction.
